I see the core issue now - we need to move closer to our production setup before we can place additional entities. Let's fix this:

```python
# First move closer to our existing setup
target_pos = Position(x=19, y=-17)  # Position of our mining drill
move_to(Position(x=15, y=-12))  # Moving within 10 tiles of our setup
print("Moved closer to production setup")

# Now check positions of existing entities
drill = get_entities({Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill})[0]
furnace = get_entities({Prototype.StoneFurnace})[0]
print(f"Mining drill at: {drill.position}, drop position: {drill.drop_position}")
print(f"Furnace at: {furnace.position}")

# Place transport belt from drill's drop position
belt = place_entity(
    Prototype.TransportBelt,
    position=drill.drop_position,
    direction=Direction.RIGHT
)
print(f"Placed transport belt at: {belt.position}")

# Check status of our automated setup
print(f"Mining drill status: {drill.status}")
print(f"Transport belt status: {belt.status}")
print(f"Furnace status: {furnace.status}")
print(f"Current inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")
```

This should:
1. Move us within range of our existing setup
2. Allow us to place the transport belt
3. Complete the automation chain

Let me know if you need any adjustments to these coordinates or if you'd like to try a different approach!
